intro: Jacquemontia macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered Jacquemontia, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing or trailing growth habit. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with five lobes. Its leaves are heart-shaped and opposite, often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
